message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of the Earth's rotation and its effect on seasons. As the Earth rotates around a star (in this case, the sun), it experiences different seasons. This is because different parts of the Earth receive different amounts of sunlight depending on their position relative to the sun. Option (A) is incorrect because the Earth's rotation does not cause it to freeze solid. Option (B) is also incorrect because the Earth remains the same size even as it rotates. Option (C) is incorrect because the Earth's rotation does not cause it to explode.
